DataElement.preferredDefinition: The period of time a probiotic has been taken.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A live microorganism used as a dietary supplement to help with digestion and normal bowel function. It may also help keep the gastrointestinal (GI) tract healthy. A bacterium found in yogurt called Lactobacillus acidophilus, is the most common probiotic.:Having been accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.
